channel.title: How to wire potentiometers into MIDI cable with a breadboard?
channel.description: I've bought a bunch of potentiometers and the like plus a breadboard and MIDI adapter for my project, and I want to connect all of them to a single MIDI cable to go to the Axoloti core. How would I go about doing that? Or is it best to wire them directly into the axoloti core?

item.title: How to wire potentiometers into MIDI cable with a breadboard?
item.dc:creator: @TheDasMan
item.description:

Thanks! This was just what I needed

item.source: How to wire potentiometers into MIDI cable with a breadboard?

item.title: How to wire potentiometers into MIDI cable with a breadboard?
item.dc:creator: @Gavin Gavin
item.description:
@Gavin wrote:

Are you saying, you want to connect the potentiometers to send MIDI data down a MIDI cable into the Axoloti ? If this is the case, you need to connect the pots to a device that translates the details into MIDI messages.
You can certainly connect them directly to the Axo pins, you can get some connection details from here,

Official Pin Outs revised (work in progress) User Guide
I'll be working on revising this post here, I was going to write it in a text document but realized it would be easier for me to get all the images if I just made it here. I was looking for a a save feature so I could wait to post until complete but could not find it. So please note this is all a work in progress and NEEDS further revision/information. GPIO Overview [image] VDD versus VDDA versus VDDC VDD is the digital 3.3V supply, use it to power external logic VDDA is the analog refeâ€¦

Read full topic
